name: Waldorf Astoria New York

reviews.title: Waldorf Astoria - Manhattan NY
reviews.text: I stayed at the Waldorf Astoria from Jan 21-28, 2005. A couple of observations: (1) the facility is older; but it is very well maintained. But I admit that I wanted to stay here just to experience this hotel; for example, the lobby area is of a style that just isn’t replicated anymore. (2) Evidently, the site hosts a lot of meetings and other functions. So after coming back to the hotel after work, the lobby was very crowded. (Suggestion: if you can, enter through the Lexington Ave entry. It is usually the Park Ave side of the building that is crowded.) Fortunately, security staff manning their post is very obvious. (3) The service extended to me was very good. Example: I arrived at the hotel at 5:30am after a “red-eye” flight. Unfortunately, all the rooms were full, and no one had check out yet. The clerk made a specific attempt to get me a larger, corner room (he noted that I would be staying for a week), and asked house keeping to expedite the cleaning of that room when it became available. For my part, I went to the office, and my room was ready for me by lunch time. I did have the option to stay at another (newer) hotel, but all in all, I would say that it was worth staying at least once, for the experience of it all. pchnmain

reviews.title: Very grand but doesn't deserve the reputation
reviews.text: We (two adults, two children) stayed for six nights at the Waldorf. The public spaces downstairs are impressive but the room was ordinary and although there were four of us in the room we were given two glasses, two coffee cups etc. Decided to have afternoon tea and when we arrived at the time booked we were told that we would have to come back in 20 minutes because they had only one table for four and they were expecting a VIP. Returned after twenty minutes to be told we would need to wait another twenty minutes. Told them politely to stuff it and left with the VIP still not having appeared. Hotel is brilliantly positioned and for what we paid great value, we had a good deal through Expedia, though I wouldn't pay the normal rates which are based purely on the name.

reviews.title: Fantastic!
reviews.text: I have just returned from a four night stay at the Waldorf Astoria, and have to say that I was seriously impressed! I had read a number of terrible reviews on this site after booking, and came fairly close to cancelling my reservation. I'm glad I didn't!

reviews.title: Daughter Thought It Would Be Cool
reviews.text: On arrival at the hotel, there were a few people in front of me in the check-in queue, but I was promptly whisked off to Diamond Check-In to avoid waiting. My room was fabulous, and beautifully decorated. I did request a room change the following day as I'm a light sleeper and it was a little noisy, but this was done with no problem and the room I was moved to was even nicer than the first.

reviews.title: Betraying a storied hotel
reviews.text: Having read other reviews, I was concerned that staff might be less pleasant to guests, who, like me, are in their twenties or thirties, but that fear was unfounded. During my entire stay, all of the staff with whom I came into contact were delightful and very happy to help.
Excellent service, spacious rooms.
reviews.title: Nice, old fashion.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The position of the hotel is definetly one of the best in town. A lot of nice restaurants near the hotel. Hotel restaurants are excellent, but $$$ plus.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend for NYC.
reviews.title: Nice Time, a little dated...but historic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perhaps our expectatives were too high on the Waldorf because even if the rooms are nice with plenty of space (for NY STD they are very big), the commons areas are very nice, the service was OK and everything worked fine in general, we didn't experience anything unique, which we have experienced in other Hotels for a lot less money.
reviews.title: paint it, polish it, varnish it. Its still a turd

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a weekend trip to NYC. We stayed at the Waldorf from Friday to Sunday. We actually used Hilton Honors points, so we didn't pay for the room. I am actually glad that was the case because I probably would have been a little dissapointed had we paid high prices. The hotel was very clean, just a little too old for my taste. But, I feel you have to stay there at least once in your life. It was very opulent and historic. The staff was very nice, very helpful. We actually didn't eat there, but the Sunday Brunch looked awesome. We stayed in a regular room, it was just a little small. (which is typical of NYC hotels) It could have used a little updating. But, the beds were very comfortable. The shower was very good. And there were robes in the room. All in all, a great stay, but was glad we didn't pay $1200 for two days to stay there.
reviews.title: You have to do this at least once in you lifetime
Just what we wanted
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is great as you are right in the centre of Manhattan. The sightseeing 'hop on and off' buses stop right by the hotel). The hotel lobby has a definite wow factor and decor is impressive. We loved the feel of the hotel which has an elegance and grandeur in its main reception areas. Considering the amount of visitors to the hotel (we stayed between Christmas and New Year) the hotel was kept very clean and tidy. The flower arrangements in the main reception were beautiful and much admired by people. We found the staff to be very helpful in all departments. Trips were booked for us and our request for an adapter for our room was attended to that day. Staff were polite and attentive. There were obviously some very wealthy guests staying at the hotel during our time there but we were treated equally by the staff. Our room was on the 10th floor and was well appointed with two large beds for our family of three. The only criticism was that the bathroom washbasin was cracked but we considered this to be a minor issue. We did not have a view from the window but this did not concern us as it was dark by the time we returned to the hotel after a day sightseeing. I would have liked to open the window for some fresh air but this was not possible.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on a room only basis and had one meal at the Bull and Bear within the hotel. Although the Maitre'D was a touch formidable he did find us a table. The food though expensive was cooked to perfection and we thoroughly enjoyed our meal. My husbands lamb was the best he had ever tasted at any hotel and my wild salmon was delicious.
reviews.title: wonderful stay at the waldorf

reviews.text: We felt that the hotel was like a grand old lady and although she seems a little faded in parts this only adds to the charm of the place in a city where everything is so glisteningly new and perfect.
reviews.title: Very Busy- Quality vs quantity

reviews.text: *** GREAT EXPERIENCE*** we went for christmas dec. 22-27. i was a little concerned because of reviews i had read here.However, we loved it lovely hotel and great room(23rd. corner rm. overlooking park ave.) staff was first rate and a great location.Also,while your there see Jersey Boys best theatre exp.in many years.Happy new year!!!
reviews.title: Suite Deal
Nice Experience but Not As Expected
reviews.text: Staying at this hotel presently Suite 700F. Very busy Christmas period from 22dec - 27th dec. After travelling all night to get to the US we were told at reception at 10am that the room was not available till 3 that afternoon (check out time is 12 for suites then they have to clean the room). Lobby had a queue to wait for reception which took 15 minutes. Lots of tourists wandering through- felt like a lab rat-maybe I should have more bling on!! No transit room that we could wait in and the kids were very disappointed that they had to wait 5 hours till they could relax. Room is pleasant - homely. No view and the garbage trucks come past at 3am everymorning which is very noisy. The heater in the room looks like it was installed in the 60's and does not really heat the room.
Just completed my east coast trip with a 2-night stay at the Waldorf.
reviews.title: Charming but a bit dated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a HHonor Diamond member, we were upgraded to a 2-room Park Avenue view suite. However, some of the windows look out to scaffolding, as the property is undergoing some remodeling, so we can only enjoy "partial" Park Avenue view.
reviews.title: Beautiful and iconic

reviews.text: The suite is very spacious, but a bit dated. The bathroom is very small, but clean, well-stocked and functional.
reviews.title: Fabulous !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We read all the reviews before booking, so we expected the room to be a bit dated with old fixtures and furnishings. In my opinion, they actually added to the charm of this hotel.
reviews.title: A rip off from start to finish, service appalling

reviews.text: All in all, a pleasant, but not perfect stay.
reviews.title: Disappointing
Not A Five Star Hotel nor close.
reviews.text: This place was a mess. No one greeted us upon arrival (so that means no doorman or bell service.) The place is a maze from the start. No signs to where exactly is the front desk. Beautiful inside, high ceilings, big sparkling Christmas tree, marble tables with nice flower arrangements, etc. Used the self check in machine because there was an extremely long check-in line (3pm). To find out that our room was not ready and that we had to wait in the long line. 30 minutes later, got keys to our Park View room and their was no bell person available to bring our luggage to the room. So we brought it up ourselves. The place is the most confusing place ever (it was built in the shape of like 4 H's put together and they had lots of rooms). Also no upgrade was available even though we were Hilton silver members. After 30 minutes of being lost on the 12th floor we finally find our room. Oh and the views of the park were excellent (NOT!). We were on the 12th floor and could not even see the park. Also it was not views of central park it was views of their own little park that they developed themselves. So basically the only thing that we had good views of was the room on the other side of the H. The bathroom was made out of marble (old) but nice, no jets in tub and small tub. No special soap or shampoo... these were ones that you may find at let's say comfort inn. Beds were great and very comfortable. No plasma TV = junky comfort inn style television. the internet costs like $20 a hour. You have to request turn down service. On the plus side Hilton… being a silver member sent us a bottle of wine and chocolates which was designed like art (almost too good to eat.) The room was nice but needed a paint job and for those that work their it was room 1278(also the ceiling looked like it was going to fall). My advice if this place is $300 a night it's worth the additional $200 to stay at trump (that’s how bad it was). Read my trump review. Self check out was easy…that was great because I just wanted to check out and get back to trump. Again no service with luggage, etc. Oh I just noticed they charged me an additional $2... It was like my room charge and then $2 more! What?

reviews.title: Best NYC has to offer
reviews.text: To stay at the Waldorf Astoria is to appreciate a time and place where things were done differently.

reviews.title: Superb
reviews.text: If you are counting the pennies, don't even consider this hotel. Although to be honest, it is reasonably priced, but, you need to expect the extras!
We stayed there in September 2004, we escaped Hurricane Ivan in Florida, only to find it caught up with us in NYC....can't help the weather.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel - staff overworked!
Bring plenty of spending money!
reviews.text: At 8:00am we awoke to the sound of a thunderstorm and a leaky window. While most would complain, we knew what a hurricane could do, and this was nothing to worry about!

I wondered, why the reviews posted here differ so much in rating the hotelrooms and staff. I even supposed some of the (overly positive) reviews being feigned. So, I was a little apprehensive, also because two friends joined us there for over night stays due to my suggestion of this hotel.
reviews.title: Pros and Cons

reviews.text: To begin with, there are many aspects I liked about this hotel. Above all, it is classic and old fashioned and I do like that. The price (329 USD) was good compared to other high class hotels in that mid town location.
reviews.title: Your money could be better spent elsewhere

likes.disliked: — The rooms were old and needed a big rennovation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival, the super shuttle from JFK let us off at the motor entrance. He told us, that a concergie would take care of us. Odd enough, we saw at least six employees waiting and NO one took notice of us and our luggage. So we chose of the side entrances and took our way towards reception.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel
Wonderful Classic Hotel
reviews.text: On check-in, waiting time was short and the employee booked us in efficiently and politely. He (probably) upgraded us into a corner room (11th floor in a wing towards 50th street) and took care that our friends arriving two days later would get an adjacent room.

The room had a good size, an old closet in the entrance area, a perfect bed, a bath-room with a big shower and a window. There were no curtains at that window, only a blind, which we had to pull down when using the toilet. We reported this to the reception desk, the employee listened carefully, but curtains never appeared throughout the stay. The view was not over impressive but not bad either. It was memorial day with obviously less traffic, no noise disturbed during the night. The air condition was an individual device and a little noisy.
reviews.title: A nice stay
Beautiful Hotel...Arf!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Waldorf during one of the coldest spells of winter weather. we had a lovely suite...but the reason I did not rate this hotel with 5 stars is because there was a dog in a neighboring room. This dog would bark whenever it heard a noise, and woke us up in the middle of the night every night we were there!! The Westminster Dog Show was that very weekend.....need I say more?

This hotel is terrible. Its really sad, because this hotel was really a grand place at one time. The problem is it hasn't been updated since then. The lobby is reminiscent of the 1940's but with no modern upgrades. II would venture to say that the carpet hasn't been upgraded in 20 years. The corridors are not lit well and kind of scary. You have to use your key card to access the elevator (I thought this was a 5-star hotel?). The room was a complete let down. I had a reservation for 5 nights and left after one. Here's why:
reviews.title: The hotel that time forgot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. The internet in the room didn't work. They actually have a personal Cisco wireless router in each room. Is this a dorm room? Really? You have to find your room # in the list of 30+ wireless networks. Mine did not work. They also have the old school wired connection as well. That didn't work either. It wasn't just me; one of my colleagues stayed here and couldn't get internet access either.
reviews.title: Elegant luxury with excellent staff service.

reviews.text: 2. The room itself hasn't been upgraded in some time. That would be fine if it was in good shape but it wasn't. The paint was chipping in the bathroom, the desk had several nicks on it and the room is very dark. The bathroom is really small and has a weird medicine cabinet. Maybe this was the trend in the 40's?
reviews.title: Good hotel, not worh the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. HBO kept going in and out on the TV. Not a huge deal but it was a Sunday night and I love True Blood!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was very OK. The lobby is very nice and has an atmosphere of old heritage. Polite receptionist who was friendly and gave us a room on the 26.th floor. I belive we were upgraded, but not sure.
reviews.title: As expected

reviews.text: The room was spacious with a large flat screen TV, double bed, safe, mini-bar, AC, bath tub etc. We were given free wifi access at check in.
reviews.title: Nice but rooms nothing special

reviews.text: We got vouchers for complimentrary breakfasts at Starbucks which is located at ground floor.
reviews.title: The lobby is exquisite and enchanting but the magic stops there!
No twin room; then billing malpractice
reviews.text: All in all I would say that the staff was friendly and helpful. The public areas at the hotel is nice. I find that the rooms are the largest drawback at the hotel. The room we stayed in should have been given a make over.

My daughters and I stayed 5 nights. Our room was clean, comfortable but nothing special. The public areas of the hotel are beautiful and it was a lovely experience for us to stay here. The location of the hotel was perfect for us, with some great places to eat within walking distance.
reviews.title: Old yes but not outdated !

reviews.text: Let's be upfront - I was thrilled to be booked into the Waldorf Astoria, even though anticipating that it would be a faded and worn shadow of its Thirties glory. And it was, but I would still go again with the family just to share with them a New York landmark.
reviews.title: Shabby, but you have to go

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in three rooms over 4 nights. The first room was tiny with two double beds lacking any form of back support. Was moved to a quirky mini-suite overlooking the front entrance. This is the sort of room which makes staying in an old hotel so memorable. It had an entrance foyer, bedroom, a huge dressing room (large enough for a small couch, dressing table and two armoires) and an art deco bathroom on a raised platform. Incredible. The third room was a nicer version of the first.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic!

reviews.text: All the rooms were worn and in need of repainting, new furniture and carpets. But it was all well worth staying for the fireplaces in the halls, lobby area and the ability to say that you stayed at the Waldorf=Astoria.
reviews.title: I was amazed by the heritage and splendor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here 6th - 8th June as part of a 5-night NY trip to celebrate a 50th birthday. From the moment we arrived till the moment we left we were treated so well, the staff were all pleasant, helpful, attentive, no pretentiousness, and a real credit to the hospitality industry! We were upgraded to a suite which was absolutely beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean. The bathroom had plentiful towels and toiletries, the shower had power, the bed was huge and the living area with its gorgeous chandelier was just magnificent! The staff sent up a bottle of bubbly to help us celebrate too! We had a couple of drinks in Sir Harry's bar where the high standard of service was replicated, nice dish of complimentary mixed nuts! - and the prices weren't too bad in comparsion to the big measures!
reviews.title: Glamour and glitz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel, you just cannot fault it.

reviews.text: You can really tell how well run a hotel is when it is at its maximum capacity - the Waldorf 'wobbled' badly but didnt quite fall apart. The stay was fine but not wonderful.
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two things attracted us back to the hotel after a stay around 10 years ago. Firstly the public rooms remain superb - especially in the morning or late evening when it's a little more subdued. Im not sure the introduction of starbucks in the building is a good idea generally.
reviews.title: Would return tomorrow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The W=A location remains a key factor - 200 metres to the main shopping and attractions.
reviews.title: What a Grand Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check-in queues remain unacceptably large with maybe only 4-5 of the desks in service. However, once there, they handled our check-in quickly. To be honest Hilton gold membership does not really count for much when the place is busy - no room upgrades - but they did offer free drinks or alternatives.
reviews.title: Loved The Waldorf

likes.liked: — It's traditional style and excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed on Sept 11 & 12. It was our 40th Wedding Anniversary. When I called to re-confirm I mentioned it. We arrived and checked in and went to our room (1414). It was very large, great view of Park Ave. It had a large marble bath. In the closet there were two Bathrobes (very plush) and bath towels that were as large as beach towels ,also very thick. We were very impressed. The room was immaculate with thick wool carpeting,rich furniture and a marble fireplace. After resting the doorbell rang (It is so much nicer than knocking) and it was a waiter with a bottle of champagne on ice with two glasses and a card from the manager wishing ua a Happy 40th Anniversary. This was our first time at the Waldorf. Imagine how they treat their Regulars??? We will also be writing the Manager. For the Price. If you want to be treated like ROYALTY chose the Waldorf. We will be back for our 45th.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I booked this hotel completely by accident, and when I found out how much I paid on booking.com (ALL NON REFUNDABLE!>>) Had a small heartattack (it ended up being almost $400 a night for me and my mom) but after the initial shock, and since it was non refundable, I just decided to sit back and enjoy it. What choice did I have?...
reviews.title: Loved New York, loved the waldorf even more...

reviews.text: Then I read the reviews here, and my heart really sank, so I went there ready for a fight and ready for a huge disappointment but had a blast!
reviews.title: I have just returned from a weeks stay at...

reviews.text: First of all, a quick tip - order the Super Shuttle online before you leave, order a round trip to and from the airport and add the tip. Believe me, you will thank me! Saves time and money.
reviews.title: Nothing Special Here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Then, I got to the hotel at midnight, my mom got here before me, and it was all great. We stayed in room 883 (not in the towers), and it was fantastic. Don't expect a nice view (our window overlooked the W hotel) because this is New York City - all you see around you are sky scrapers. The room was gorgeous, the bathroom was great, flat screen tv (for the little we had time to watch). Room service was fantastic, the Concierges (there were several) were always helpful. Gave us a map of the subway, a map of the area, AND a map of the buses. They also printed our boarding passes before we left (so don't pay for the business center, it's too much), AND changed our seats for us on the plane...

likes.disliked: — it was a little bit snooty

reviews.text: It had always been a dream of mine to stay in what is probably thee most famous old hotel in the world.

reviews.text: What makes it special is the feeling of history that surrounds the hotel. The grand foyer is so recognisable from all those movies!The rooms are pretty small though and just a tiny bit aging, and it is very pricey, but if you book well in advance you can get pretty good deals..
reviews.title: Lived up its reputation!

reviews.text: The Waldorf is perfectly located for a trip to Manhattan..within walking distance of The Rockerfeller Centre and Times Square.

likes.liked: — A piece of history, location, comfort, style.
