reviews.text: The Breakfast buffet is unbelievably pricey at about $25 per person, but so worth it. Probably the best brekkie ive had in a hotel.
reviews.title: Waldorf Astoria A Great Getway Locale for Exploring NYC
Disappointing
reviews.text: The architecture and decor in the main lobby is a must. This did make the stay there worth while. However, the staff were extrenely arrogant and patronising and it made us feel slightly inferior - not something we wanted to feel when we were paying $1000 for 4 night's stay. The room itself was small, dark and with a terrible view. The sink in the bathroom needed a complete overhaul and this, along with other nuances, marred our stay at this majestic landmark.

reviews.title: loved every minute!
reviews.text: My husband and 2 children (11 & 13) stayed at this awesome hotel for 5 nites in one of the suites. We had plenty of help with check-in and our baggage delivery to our room. The lobby is so impressive with these enormous fresh flower arrangements, I could sit in the lobby for hours just watching all the people from all over the world mingling (but I really didn't have time). Too much shopping, plays and sites to see. Every time we came thru the front doors, I felt right at home. The bed was the most comfortable one I'd ever slept in (by the way, when I got home I ordered all the stuff to make our bed just as comfy, and it is!)

reviews.title: Disappointed - Well below par
reviews.text: The last nite there, they were making a movie using the revolving front doors which we found very exciting.We enjoyed this hotel so much we will definitely go back there as soon as we can!

Having Just flown from London to New York to spend a lovely weekend as a tourist (not the usual business trip), I booked a double deluxe room (basic room to you & I) being a gold Hilton Honors card holder I must admit I did expect a lot from this hotel and it let me down on almost every detail. the check-in took at least 15 minutes. the room was small even by London standards. We were obvisously near an extractor outlet because with the window open 1cm there was an awful smell of cooking food. This hotel is old, and it shows! whilst I agree that a lot of modern hotels feel cold & stark. This hotel is souless. As a frequent traveller around the world I have stayed in many top class hotels. The Waldorf=Astoria is not a top class hotel. My recomendation is to either stay at the Intercontinental next door or the Ritz Carlton overlooking Central Park. I know I will next time.
reviews.title: Waldorf=Astoria at Christmas & New Year
Aging Lady
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Waldorf=Astoria for 15 nights over Christmas and the New Year, and it was fantastic in every way.

Well this place is a great location. Close enought to shopping and restaruants but not right next to you so you don't have that much foot traffic around. So given the other reviews, I must have really lucked out. My room was spacious, newer furnishings, beautiful bedding, bathroom with marble counter top and hugh medicine cabinet to store your stuff, two plush bathrobes in the closet and a nice chair and ottoman all provided a wonderful room experience. The staff was courteous but not over accomodating but it is New York. They were, however, able to get me into my room my 1PM so I was thankful for that.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but worth the money

likes.disliked: — No coffee maker and charge for internet access.

reviews.text: Again this is New York, but I still have diffuculity spending $16 for a glass of wine in the lobby bar that is, by the way, pretty noisy. The lack of a coffee maker in the room is amazing in this day and age and while there is a Starbucks in the lobby, I hate to have to get dressed and go down there each morning. The $14.95 daily charge for itnernet usage is part of the nickel and dime stuff that a hotel of this magnitude should not subscirbe. Also beware that when you are quoted the price for the room there are also about 15% additional for various taxes.
reviews.title: Big disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So it was a nice hotel in a great location but but not worth the additional money.
reviews.title: Superb

likes.liked: — Friendly welcoming staff, great room, location

reviews.text: When my company booked me at the Waldorf Astoria for a business trip I was overjoyed. Even though it would be for only one night, it would provide me with an opportunity to stay at this legendary hotel. The lobby, the elevators and the general ambience lived up to the reputation; however the room was a big disappointment.
reviews.title: Old World...New perspective

reviews.text: The room was very small, with faded wallpaper and musty carpeting and the window opened out to service chutes with view of piping. The bathroom was tiny and dirty.
reviews.title: A Beautiful Piece of history

reviews.text: If you're a history buff or enjoy the atmosphere of by-gone eras, then you'll enjoy The Waldorf Astoria. The location is fabulous and very central to many of the "must see" sights. Our room was large and had been redone at some point, but the carpet is old, the sofa was old, and the room decor was very "grandma-ish". The price point is high but what isn't in NYC these days? The buffet breakfast was good, but certainly not worth the price, but then again, it's NYC. Would I stay there again - no - I would be just as happy in a more modern hotel in a smaller room, that was less of a tourist sight in itself.
reviews.title: Historic Landmark

reviews.text: Great 5 night stay as a family.
reviews.title: Aged but full of character.

reviews.text: Service was good although drinks and minibar is pricey as you would guess.
reviews.title: Good, but falls short of its own aspirations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are perhaps a little tired compared to much newer hotels but the character of the hotel prevails and you can't help loving the place.
reviews.title: First Time at Waldorf Astoria
Perfect
reviews.text: I got upgraded to the Waldorf Towers, so these comments are with respect to the expected standards of a very high-end facility. I had a nice although not overly large, corner room. It was clean. No sign of the bedbugs that are such a problem these days in NYC. The bed was comfortable, the towels thick, and the provided robe was comfortable. It was fun using the provided remote controls to make the shades go up and down and the blinds open and close. The bathroom was all marble, something so needless as to itself be fun. But, all in all, not the experience it could and should have been. Here are a few issues: 1. While the automated blinds and shares were fun, they failed to keep out the light. 2. There was a a considerable tangle of wires behind the desk, leaving no place to plug in chargers. 3. The TV was a HD plasma, but only analog signals were supplied, resulting in a poor quality picture with people appear short and squat. There was a surprisingly limited number of channels from which to select. There was a TV in the mirror in bathroom, but it didn't work properly so that it had only two channels. The rugs in the halls needed shampooing. The switches were extremely fancy but their internal illumination couldn't be turned off, thereby resulting in their emitting sleep-disturbing light even when it was dark outside. The shower head was too large for the amount of water provided resulting in a concentrated rather than dispersed stream of water.

reviews.title: Crass Waldorf
reviews.text: The Waldorf has become a sub standard hotel operating on the fumes of it's long past glory days. When my daughter and I arrived at 8:00 in the evening, we were required to stand in line for a half hour, bags in tow, waiting to check in. We finally were able to lug our bags to a room with a very small window and a strange smell. We did find a front desk minder the next day who was kind enough to switch us to a smaller room with a window and no smell (I'm thinking of a certain Terintino movie here.) I had to wait in the tiny work out room for an aerobic machine and pay $25.00 for the privilege. We only ate breakfast there once because of an early morning appointment. Our two bowls of oatmeal and cold coffee cost a mere $50.00. I guess I'm a slow learner, or perhaps too optimistic. In the future I will always seek out small hotels.

Stayed at the hotel from the 15th to 19th of August. The hotel has lots of history and the lobby area is great. It feels like a grand hotel but the rooms are in need of an update. They are quite spacious but the bathrooms and corridors in the hotel need updating. Still they are better than most New York hotels.
reviews.title: good hotel great for celeb spotting

reviews.text: We saw David Beckham in the lobby during our trip and were told many famous people stay there in the waldorf towers!!
reviews.title: A dream realised and a tired old lady

reviews.text: The bar area was nice but £4 for a bottle of beer. Some areas of the hotel are being updated
reviews.title: Loved the Waldorf Astoria!!

likes.liked: — THe Decor and the beautiful flower arrangement in Lobby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is perfect and close to all attractions . A taxi to Soho of south manhatten is only £5 and is the best way to travel.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are quite small, but clean. Location is great if you want to be within walking distance of Times Square and Broadway. I stayed there becasue I won the trip through work. I wouldn't stay there again if I had the choice. I would shop around and look for a better deal. If you're looking for luxury try the Hotel Gansevoort especially if you're going there in summer as they have a rooftop pool. It is in Tribeca which is further away but taxi's are cheap. If you need to stay midtown, try the peninsula as they have a rooftop bar that opens at 4pm. Overall, it was nice to tell people back home i'd stayed at the Waldorf Astoria, but the reality is that it was slightly dissapointed. I never got to try the steak restaurant as it was closed for refurbishment but the steak does look terrific on the pictures.
reviews.title: Slightly Dissapointing

likes.disliked: — I expected it to be nicer

reviews.title: no big deal
reviews.text: Highlight of the holiday was a restaurant called Patsy's near broadway. Made famous by Frank Sinatra and has celeb's dine there on a regular basis. Fantastic food and even better service. Also try top of the rock to avoid ques like the ones at the Empire State. Dinner cruise on the World Yatch was worth every penny. Men need dinner jackets.

reviews.title: underwhelmed
reviews.text: Little Italy is only a few streets of Italian Restaurants. Canal street is great for Jolex and Prado watches and wallets! Quite scary though. Definitely do the Hop on-off bus tour and see everything in one foul swoop to give you enough time to do the things you really want to do.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: New York was fantastic. We hired cycles in central park and ate at a table front seat at the boathouse lake restaurant. I loved New York and will definitely go back, maybe next time in the winter so I can experience the christmas trees and ice rinks etc... if you're going in summer it realy is a once in a lifetime experience and you'll love every minute of it. If you love the sun and love to sunbathe, you can't been spain or tenerife and a quarter of the price.
reviews.title: Waldorf Astoria--Better as a Salad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For Location the hotel is fab. If you're expecting to be wow'd then you best take a reality check. It's clean and pleasen't and the lobby is amazing. It is slighly dated but the beds are comfortable.
reviews.title: Much better than expected

likes.disliked: — Cost of drinks at bar, but it is NYC so expected

reviews.text: Spent two nights here while attending a conference. Tim, at the front desk made and extra effort to find a very spacious business king room for us. He also gave us several hilton honors comp drink coupons as i mentioned it was a special occasion for us. Ram at concierge printed out our boarding passes for our return trip...after I asked where the business office was. i was expecting to get nicked for printing, often the case nowadays,
reviews.title: Great staff at a great hotel

reviews.text: Bed in room was top notch as were the linens, towels and robes.
reviews.title: A horrific ordeal, never to be repeated

reviews.text: I thought staying at a hotel such as this, with a longstanding reputation, would be a fabulous experience. I couldn't have been more wrong.
reviews.title: Oh no, No coffee in rooms

reviews.text: On our final day in New York, the hotel suffered a burst water pipe, and the luggage room was seriously flooded. As a result, all of our luggage and possessions were damaged or destroyed. Despite the flood occurring at 11am, no one from the hotel contacted us during the day. We did not discover the damage until after we had collected our suitcases and were about to leave the hotel - the bellhop called us back to "just check nothing was damaged after a slight leak". We opened our suitcases to discover that everything was soaked in dirty river water, and virtually every item destroyed.
reviews.title: True perfection

reviews.text: The level of customer service that we received was zero. The "manager" we were allowed to speak to was rude, discourteous, patronising and unapologetic. All he wanted to do was get us out of the hotel. At no point did he apologise for the damage caused to our belongings.
reviews.title: Very Disappointing

reviews.text: Stayed for 5 nights with my Wife and 2 teenage daughters. It's a nice Hotel with really nice staff. Just a couple of observations, watch out for the people selling "Studio 57" Hilton timeshare in the lobby, they are all very polite but it is timeshare. Also we had no safe in the room but there are saftey deposit boxes behind reception where you can lock valuables, the lady who runs this was delightful and very helpful. Avoid Oscars for breakfast unless you want to pay €160 plus tip for 4 of you.
reviews.title: Still a Very Good Hotel

reviews.text: It is an impressive place with a justifiably impressive reputation.
reviews.title: Beautiful Historic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was booked through the Javits Center hotel listings. I got a great rate and I was pleasantly surprised by the service at the hotel. It is a huge place and swarming with people. Lots of security too. The lobby is gorgeous. The room was large and we had a view and could see the sky, which sometimes does not happen at NY hotels. The only downsides were the wifi does not work in the rooms. You had to go to the lobby which luckily is quite large. The other downside is the food. It was $80 for dinner for one person for a basic meal, nothing too extravagant. However, the location is excellent and it was an easy walk or taxi ride to other restaurants. The bus for the Javits Center picks up and drops off right in front of the hotel. We left our luggage with the luggage storage downstairs the day we checked out and went to dinner. Picked up the bags and headed to our airport hotel for the night and very early flight the next day. All in all a great experience! Will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Trading Off Past Glories

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Okay so the lobby and communal areas are just as ornate as all the guides suggest but beyond that the hotel is trading off past glories. The fixtures and furnishings in the rooms are faux period but getting badly worn around the edges. The room service prices are pretty astronomical considering that the quality of the fare being served is just mediocre at best. Also, there's an oddly wannabe ellitist "dress code" for smart causal wear in the evenings which might be aceptable for any fine dining rooms but is only serves to make you less than comfortable in the communal areas. That being said, the location is of course superb but it's sufficient to visit rather than stay in the hotel to experience a little bit of history.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: We stayed at The Waldorf in December for my birthday and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The christmas decorations were out of this world and the reception area took our breath away every time we entered the lobby. Check in was fairly slow, but no problems. The room was nicely decorated, but fairly small and no tea making facilities (but there is a starbucks by the main entrance). The bathroom was very tired. The shower was useless - the spray went everywhere and made the floor slippery.
reviews.title: Still great, still a legend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed five nights. The room was clean and comfortable but nothing special; yes,they knew it was a special occasion. Breakfast is expensive but the perfect service makes up for that. Dinner at the Bull and Bear is very expensive but very good. The public rooms are something special though some of the the bars are dark and crowded. The biggest blot is the squalid Starbucks - totally out of place. Because of our special occasion we were rewarded with breakfast vouchers for Starbucks - what an insult! When I went to pay the bill I found $198 that should not have been there; it took a lot of trouble to get it removed and I will be checking my credit card statement very carefully.
reviews.title: Check your bill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: By all means stay at the Waldorf but don't let them see your credit card.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: We found the hotel to be exactly as it says in terms of standards and space. The room was very spacious and the level of service was impressive. It is expensive however it is a great hotel to launch your New York experience. It is close to the subway, cross town buses to the ferry, but also to delicatessens and some lovely eateries. (buy a weekly for the subway, it is money well spent) Only a 15 minute walk to Times Square and Broadway yet far enough away to be able to escape the noise and bussle of the square. Easy to get to all you need to do in New York.
reviews.title: huge and dated

reviews.text: vast hotel in real need of modernisation. Meeting rooms were bizarre and dinner was disappointing
reviews.title: It grew on us

reviews.text: Stunning lobby and communal areas, rooms on arrival looked a bit tired (rather used to hotels with designer bathrooms and trendy window dressings!) , but the hotel just grew on us - we really felt as if we were sharing a little bit of New York history. Staff were excellent. I would stay again. The reason for 4 not 5? Why do they have to charge 15.95 per night per DEVICE for in room wifi. We got fed up with going to the lobby to use wifi- and I'd have thought it would be better for the hotel to waive this fee and not have people loitering in the lobby just to use the wifi. Without this issue, it would have been 5 stars.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our family, which consists of myself, my husband and my two daughters aged 12 and 15 stayed at the Waldorf for 4 nights from 24 May. It was our first time to New York and we all really loved it. The Hotel is very classic so anyone wanting contemporary will not be happy. However I liked it and prefer the old style. The room was rather dusty around the fixtures and fittings but the bathroom was cleaned well every day and we always had the room done by the time we returned from our outings and fresh towels. The maid came in the evening to take off the bedspreads as it was warm at night. The size of the room was adequate as it was a standard room. We had 2 double beds but we had a seperate dressing room and the bathroom was next to that so we all had privacy when required. We had room service a couple of times and that was very prompt and the food was lovely. All the staff we encountered were very well mannered and helpful. We used the safety deposit box facility which is free and found it useful to safeguard money and passports etc. Taxis were outside the Hotel to take to you to wherever you wanted to go and they are very cheap. We had a great time and will return!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
Staying at the Waldorf astoria New york
reviews.text: The experience was magnificent. The room was great. Small wardrobe. Nice size bathroom. Fresh soap daily. Not much of a view though. The staff were always helpful. Did not eat there. Breakfast was US$40.00 pp! It was close to a Starbucks. The foyer was lovely. Fully intended to have a cocktail there, but never found the time! The location is excellent. We booked early, and were pleasantly shocked with the price. There is a accommodation sale for the month of August in New York. Nearly every hotel has a room sale. There are shops at the hotel. Did not shop there. There is a postal service there. The beds had 4 pillows each, and were so pleasant to sleep on. No tea or coffee making facility though.

reviews.title: Needs focus on details
reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed 2 nights at Waldorf during what was to be NY Marathon weekend. We originally booked 4 nights, but due to the race cancellation we left NY early. In any event, we booked thru a travel agent and had arranged for a queen bedroom, upgrade upon availability, and free breakfast. When we checked in, they claimed no upgrades were available as the hotel was sold out. So, after what seemed like an eternity the front desk person selected room 839 for us. He asked for a Credit Card which i promptly gave him, and he disapearred to another room with it for a few moments. He came back and said my card doesnt work ( well it did then and it does still now). I gave him another one, and he said that one was fine. ( I still dont know why he went to another room with my card, kind of concerning) He then gave us the keys and wished us well. I asked about how we get our free breakfast, and he with confidence responded that we dont get free breakfast. I suggested he re-look at his computer as I had already confirmed twice with the hotel prior to arrival that perk. The clerk realized his error and gave us our vouchers.....Room 839 was generally fine, and what i expected for the hotel/NY. However, I did expect that the pocket door to the bathroom would work. Instead, those people in the restroom / shower get to share their experience with other persons in the room. Not a 'feature' i would expect at a Waldorf. I didnt bother complaining to the hotel during our visit, as quite honestly i was just ready to be out of the City given the marathon cancellation. Would I go back to Waldorf, yes maybe. Would i go to Waldorf over The Palace at comparable rate. That would be a tough sell.

reviews.title: Great Breakfast
reviews.text: Stayed here with my sister after a 7 hour delayed flight from Dublin, we got to the hotel at 2am and the staff were so nice. We got upgraded to the biggest room I've ever seen.

reviews.title: Guest Services Manager John [--] Should Be Fired
reviews.text: The hotel itself is old fashioned grandeur at its best. Great location of 5th Ave and you could hang out i the lobby and watch the great and the good of NYC.

reviews.title: Good hotel, but not recommended for Elite members!
reviews.text: The breakfast was a treat, our waitress, Grace ( from Dungloe 40 years earlier !!) took a shine to us, we got extra everything :)) Great stay .

We just returned from the Waldorf - January 2, 2007 to January 5, 2007. This is simply an elegant hotel - just so New York. We wanted our children 12 and 14 to get a true New York experience so we went all the way. Although the Plaza would have been our first choice in the "old days" since they are under renovation and we had stayed at the Waldorf before on business and always found it to be very nice we thought it would be a good choice and that it was. We had a mini suite with 2 bathrooms, and yes, it was old, but done so tastefully and in such timeless decor. The location is just the best, and one our children will never forget - we walked everywhere - central park, times square, 5th avenue, you name it. We also visited ground zero that was so very sad. We truly knew the World Trade Centers with the 5 buildings and spent so much time in meetings at the Windows on the World Club. Without seeing and knowing the "before" I think our children simply saw it as a "construction site."They understand how many lives were lost, but to truly understand the devistation was difficult for them as they saw us with tears in our eyes.
reviews.title: Wonderful getaway to start the new year

reviews.text: Stayed here from Jan. 1st thru Jan. 4th, 2007. While plenty of people were checking in, the wait was less than 15 minutes. The staff is what makes this hotel. They were extremely friendly and helpful. We were given complimentary vouchers for breakfast at Oscars when checking in. The breakfast was a buffet and was excellent. The waiters were attentive to our needs. The room is on the small side but not unusual for NY. We have experienced this at several other hotels in the area. We had no control over the thermostat even though it was a comfortable temperature. The bathroom was small and there isn't a place to leave your toiletry items. Plaster peeling on the ceiling but that is because there isn't a vent to pull out the steam. They delivered the newspaper to our room every morning. The hotel fire alarm went off twice, once in the evening and once about 8:30 am. On the evening alarm, they stated wait for further instructions but never came back with any instructions so we finallly went down 16 floors to the lobby along with other guests. We assumed it was a false alarm even though they didn't say that. The next morning, we ignored the alarm. The location is excellent and that is why we chose to stay at the Waldorf.
reviews.title: Great Location & Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: myself and my girlfriend stayed at this hotel from 8th-10th dec 2006 at one of the suites.
reviews.title: a must stay in this famous hotel.

likes.liked: — the size of the rooms and the quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: checking in was a bit of a problem as it was rather overcrowded we had about a 15 min wait which wasnt a problem as it was a very busy time of the year, the staff were very pleasant and looked after ourselves.
reviews.title: Comfort, Location, History

likes.liked: — The historic background of the hotel

reviews.text: there seemed to be a function on all day every day in every room so we were dodging lots of people dressed in tux`s and ball gowns.
reviews.title: Over-rated
Waldorfn Astoria
reviews.text: Spent 2 nights in the Waldorf. Was a bit unsure due some bad reviews on this site. Check in was great and our room was excellent, vWe had a King Deluxe andnit nwas deluxe in everynway. The staff we met were very helpful right down to a man who helped me down a flight of stairs with my case when the elevator was being repaired.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend it to anyone. Try the Hilton.com site for good deals.
reviews.title: Old and Over-priced

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Waldorf with my boyfriend as a weekend getaway to NYC. We picked the Waldorf because of location and hotel history. Upon our arrival, there was a long check-in line and after waiting, we found out our room would not be ready for another 2 hours. When we finally were allowed to go to our room, it was very underwhelming. The room was tiny (queen size bed) and outdated. The bathroom was small and the tub/vanity/sink was circa 1970s. Around dinner time, housekeeping insisted on scrubbing the outside of our door for five minutes knowing we were in the room... very awkward. The "luxury" room did not have simple amenities such as coffee maker/ample electrical outlets/slippers. Overall, we were extremely disappointed. It was an experience I would have expected at a $125 per night hotel vs $500+ night experience.
reviews.title: You can find better quality for your money

likes.disliked: — The hotel is over priced, there are better competitors

reviews.text: This was the third time I stayed in the hotel and on this occasion I was most disappointed.
reviews.title: luxurious position

reviews.text: New York city is unique to the world, and I like staying in uniquely New York hotels when I'm there. The Waldorf definitely qualifies. It has the great lobby, half a dozen food/drink options, and the feel of something old and wise. The lobby is always hopping, which I love. That said, the hotel doesn't do anything super - the rooms are small, some areas are a little worn, they don't always have enough people working the front desk, etc.
reviews.title: The good and bad of an old school hotel

reviews.text: But, for me, this is so much better than the cookie-cutter hotel experience that you will get at the big chains, even in NYC. When you wake up and stumble into the lobby, you won't forget what city you're in, and that's worth something. The Waldorf gets a thumbs up.
reviews.title: It Doesn't Get Any Better Than This

reviews.text: The Waldorf=Astoria not only lived up to it's legendary reputation, it exceeded it. I have stayed here several times and it has always been a phenomenal experience. On the most recent stay I brought my wife and two young children (6 and 9) up for the kids' first trip to New York.as part of a business trip I was on. The only downside to this decision is that the bar set by the Waldorf=Astoria can never be reached by anywhere else and my kids will now measure every other hotel by this stay. Every staff member is friendly, helpful, enthusiastic, professional and genuinely nice. We had the great fortune of staying in a room that almost defies description - it was beyond elegant. I have also had the pleasure to stay in other rooms which may not have been as large, but were still very luxurious and roomy. I recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to have a real New York, or for that matter, world class, experience. The room rate was an excellent value. The location is great as well - on Park Avenue, a short walk to Grand Central, Fifth Avenue and Times Square. I always look forward to staying at the Waldorf.
reviews.title: An Old Grand Place...

reviews.text: We just came back from a three-night stay with our two kids. The Waldorf is very different from our "usual," which tends to be more of the boutique, home-style, 4 or 5-star places. The Waldorf is old style. Grand. Old glamour. Traditional. It has some really great features, such as thick walls, heavy real wood doors and furniture, thick gold-colored drapes, real heavy handles for the bathroom door (so it's much easier to open when you have just put lotion on your hands!), door bell and mail slot, etc. The one and only downside is there is no free wi-fi (amazing in this day and age; even at the Hampton Inn there is free wi-fi!). We're glad to have stayed here. Would I do it again? Probably not... but if you haven't stayed here, it's a good experience. We got a really great deal off of their website (pre-paid, no money back, etc.). Comparatively, the price was much cheaper than others we'd looked at. Room service was decent, but super expensive.
reviews.title: Beautiful Classic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family and I chose to stay at the Waldorf due to the history and location of the hotel. Having read the reviews on TripAdvisor I ws confident we would not be disappointed and we were not. Even with its age the hotel was in great shape and our room was very nice. We ended up in the tower on the 35 th floor with a great view of the city. The room had a large well appointed bathroom and VERY comfortable beds. The lobby was goergous and the staff very nice and helpful. Well worth the price.
reviews.title: SO ELEGANT!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was great, very clean, great customer service. The only downfall was they have a dress code for the lobby after 6:00pm (thats difficult for tourists walking around all day sweating) and no free internet in your room. With the price they charge I believe the internet should be free for guests not for anyone that just walks in the lobby.
reviews.title: Wonderful
Visit again
reviews.text: Great location with a great service . Highlights of all great locations around new york.. Food spcially fresh.
great location in new york. Stayed for a one night get away and would do it agsin. Room was small, but acceptable Perfect loation for shopping,dining and touring.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: I stayed with my husband, mother and teenager daughter at this elegant, legendary hotel on Hilton Honors points. The hotel upgraded us to a one-bedroom suite in the Towers Section which was really nice. The suite had a feel of an earlier time but the decor and furniture were lovely. We had a breakfast the next morning which was okay; nothing spectacular. The lobby is simply elegant with the clock in the middle. We always wanted to experience the Waldorf-Astoria and was not disappointed.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our Stay at this Legendary Hotel; Elegant and Classic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, my husband and I only stayed one night in the city before flying oversee's on holiday to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. As a Hilton Diamond member, we used points for our stay that also included breakfast. Hilton really takes care of their honor members, and we were very pleasantly surprised with a large, updated suite. We found the room to be gorgeous, spacious and not at all "run-down" as I have read in other reviews. The bed was very comfortable, bathroom was huge and plenty of storage. Shortly after check in, we received a lovely bottle of sparkling wine and chocolate covered strawberries and a note from the hotel wishing us a Happy anniversary. This was greatly appreciated!
reviews.title: a very special anniversary at The Waldorf

reviews.text: The Waldorf and the Waldorf Astoria Tower is our "go-to" place in NYC. We are constantly told "Welcome Back". I have no idea how they know that. At the Peacock Bar, the Hostess, Crystal Potter, after our first trip there during this stay, not only called us by name, but also knew what we were drinking. I'm a HHonors Diamond guy, but never have treatment like we get at this property. Congratulations to Eric the Manager, and his entire staff for making every trip here feel so special.
reviews.title: Two Words - Crystal Potter!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on points recently. At a cost of 70,000 per night, I expected to be blown away as I was the Chicago Astoria. Not so... the rooms are very very small, average amenities but the bed was very comfortable. As a Diamond member, we were not upgraded period. We were given a coupon for two drinks at the bar and a coupon per day for the Starbucks on site, it provided one small coffee per person. I was more impressed with the location than the actual hotel itself. The concierge was helpful in directing us to local eateries and even made the reservations for us. Other than that, probably should have stayed at the Millennium Hilton at the other end of Manhattan.
reviews.title: Not quite what we expected.

reviews.text: We stayed at the waldorf during Hurricane Sandy. Flights were cancelled so we had an extra six night stay. it was easy to extend the stay and they didnt rip us off which was good - we heard a few people saying that their hotels had overcharged for the extended stay.
reviews.title: It was a long stay.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were nothing special but clean, toileteries were refreshed every day.
reviews.title: Skip it.

reviews.text: We had to have room service due to the storm which despite how busy they were was efficient. Breakfast was expensive but delicious!
reviews.title: "old fashioned class"
Is this Grand Central station?
reviews.text: Incredibly large and spacious hotel.
Over 1000 rooms!
reviews.title: What a wonderful place to stay in NYC

reviews.text: So busy,that the history and 'eminent elegance' is hard to take in at first as one's senses are diverted to negotiating the crowds!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Our friendly and very patient receptionist spent at least 15 minutes getting us the best possible deal. We rang up on the day, following tremendous disappointment with the Hotel Giraffe(see review..if it's published!) and were offered a room @ $309.
reviews.title: you dont get the room you paid for unless you complain!!!
Bag stolen
reviews.text: As we made our way to this thronging hotel, we decided to negotiate what deal we could arrange on a suite. We were not disappointed. For $500, we were offered a 14th floor luxury suite with breakfast. Our receptionist spent a good 15 minutes obtaining the best deal, even dissuading us from the Waldorf Towers as some of the suites there were apparently in need of decoration (not quite her words but we knew what she meant!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay was enhanced by the fact that we were upgraded on our arrival to the boutique Waldorf Towers at no extra cost. The hotel is usually very busy with business meetings, wedding receptions, graduation parties etc and can appear quite formal and as such may not suit everybody, however this is only a minor gripe and didn't detract from our stay at all. Overall it was a pleasure to stay in such a landmark hotel. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Loved the Atmosphere
Loved it!!
reviews.text: The Waldorf is a traditional style of hotel and probably some of the furnishings in the room are a bit tired looking but overlook that and it is a fantastic experience to stay there. The bed was really comfy and the room very quiet. There was always something happening in the hotel and I could have sat all day in the lobby, people watching. Sir Harry's bar does a mean G & T which was worth the $16. Great location. We bought an open top bus ticket for 3 days and used it like public transport from right outside the hotel. Ate in the Bull & Bear one night and wouldn't really recommend. Great local places for breakfast. Loved New York and thought the Waldorf made the trip really special.

We booked a 2 bedroom mini suite and were not disappointed. We spent one week here and it was wonderful. Large bedroom, separate living room with a TV in each. 2 bathrooms and large walk in closet. It was all clean and nicely decorated. Check in/ check out was very quick. We were on the 22nd floor but those lifts are so fast it wasnt a problem. The iron in the room was broken but when my daughter reported it a new one was brought within minutes
reviews.title: The worst nice hotel in the world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had buffet breakfast on morning which was lovely. We also ordered meals from room service twice. Both times it was delivered quickly and was very hot. More than enough food, with all the little touches included.
reviews.title: Top class hotel!!

likes.liked: — staying in pure luxury in one of the finest hotels in the world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Waldorf Astoria in feburary for my 30th birthday as a surpise weekend from my wife. We had an excellent corner room with with windows on two walls. The room was comfortable and of a good size and clean.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are very good and helpful.
reviews.title: Doesn't get any better ...

likes.disliked: — Location a bit further from Times Square than we prefer, but not too bad.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at the japanese restaurant , in the hotel, on the saturaday which was my birthday which was very good with a nice atmosphere .
reviews.title: Love the Waldorf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was great we were able to walk everywhere.
reviews.title: World Class... but worth the price?

likes.liked: — Historical significance, great service, perfect location.

reviews.text: There is an elegance to the grand old hotels like the Waldorf and the Plaza that is simply unmatched. So when you get the opportunity you simply can’t pass it up. We came across a great rate (< $350 a night) over this Memorial Day weekend. It was first class all the way.
reviews.title: This is how it is - Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Worst excuse for a "luxury" hotel I've ever seen, anywhere, including the Third or Fourth World. aStayed in "Upgraded" king room with Hilton Diamond (highest) status. Rooms are extremely dated and in poor condition. Bed and bed linens smelled as if they had not been changed from the last guest, the beds had to be changed twice on check in and the pillows had to be swapped out for new ones. Room was not ready, despite Diamond Status and notification to the hotel upon booking of time of arrival. Carpet was so worn as to be slippery, and indeed we did both slip several times. Very, very loud, even for location. I have lived in and visited Manhattan my whole life, and I assure you there are much better hotels at the price - try the Sherry Netherland or Lowe's Regency. When I was a child in Manhattan this was known as an hotel for business, parvenu tourists, and an "event" venue for second rate debutante balls - but I cannot think anyone in even any of these classes would put up with this hotel. If you really think there is something special about this hotel, visit the lobby and the bar - if you need to get your hair done, go the Kenneth's by all means - but for Heaven's sake, stay elsewhere!
reviews.title: Absolutely Horrid

reviews.text: I spent one night at the Waldorf last week. I usually stay in another mid-town hotel but for logistical reasons chose to stay at The Waldorf this time. I had a very nice - but perhaps atypical - experience. I booked at superior room but at check in was upgraded to a one-bedroom suite in the Waldorf Towers. Decor a little dated -- but very large and very comfortable. I was on the 33rd floor so not bothered by street noise which can be intense in Manhattan. My room rate included breakfast at Oscar's - a choice between American or Continental breakfast -- breakfast was good and they brought me a nice big pot of tea.
reviews.title: One night stay - upgrade to a suite in the Towers

reviews.text: The hotel is enormous and obviously caters to a convention/group crowd. The public areas are very nice and they showcase the long history of the hotel. Definitely NOT a boutique hotel experience.
reviews.title: Grand Art Deco Hotel

reviews.text: Location is terrific - right down the street from Saks and St. Patrick's Cathedral.
reviews.title: not worth it

reviews.text: All hotels in Manhattan are expensive but with my upgrade this was great value -- and also would have been good value even without it.
reviews.title: This is my type of hotel !

reviews.text: This place is totally resting on its laurels. Our room was large, which was about the only good point. The carpet was filthy. There were no slippers so I had to request them. They probably haven't done a thorough renovation of the room since 1970. There were layers and layers of paint on the bathroom door, closet doors, and on moulding, whch also had a nice big piece of blue painters tape stuck to it. The furnishings were tired - there was a hole in one of the lampshades. The bed itself was nice as were the sheets, but the decorative pillows and stuff were practically threadbare. The marble/granite was nice in the bathroom, but you could tell the tub had been refinished about a 50 times. There were a few layers peelng off around the drain. Can't complain about the price since we used Hilton points to stay here but if I were paying anything close to the rack rate, I'd be very annoyed. No way would I stay here again - there are so many nice hotels in NY why waste it on a has been?
reviews.title: This place is a dump

reviews.text: Having read the reviews, I must admit I was a bit apprehensive about staying here with my family, particularly given the comments on the condition of some of the rooms from many previous visitors. However, from the second we arrived until the very second we left the Waldorf, the service was excellent. It was my son's 15th birthday whilst we were in NY and I wanted to make it a special occasion. I had e-mailed the Waldorf a few days in advance explaining this and requested a nice room with a view. We were not disappointed. We had a large room (there were 4 of us) with a separate dressing room and bathroom facilities all in very good condition with an excellent view over Park Ave. The Waldorf even sent my son a personal card, some fine bottled water and exclusive chocolates for his birthday. The hotel is something special and people who plan to stay here must remember it is not a modern hotel, This is quite simply its appeal. The reception areas are stunning and the scent from the wonderful flower arrangements is simply lovely. The staff were always extremely helpful and curteous and made you feel very welcome. This is a truly special hotel which offers character and a bit of history which undoubtedly is its charm. I would have no hesit ation in recommending this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Loved it!

likes.liked: — It's overall charm and elegance not forgetting its great location

reviews.text: After reading all the negative reviews about the waldorf I was hesitant to stay. We used points for our first trip there in October 2007 and were delighted with our room, service, tour desk... everything.
reviews.title: Loved the Waldorf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned in May and our room was outrageously large for NY - with huge closet, large bathroom with seperate shower and bath, and a seperate sitting area. I love the classic elegance of the hotel and I must say we loved the Waldorf.
reviews.title: There are better options.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Converted Hilton points for my stay so did not pay. Room was very small. By the time we removed decorative pillows and bedspread walking aroudn the room was severely limited. Bathroom very nice. Air conditioner was marginal at best. If it had been warmer outside the A/C would not have been sufficient. Public spaces are gorgeous. For a nearly 80 yr old building it was very well conditioned. Service was fine. I have stayed at the Hilton NY (Ave of Americas) and for the same # of points could have stayed there and had a better room and a better location. It's a great tourist spot but there are better rooms and locations for the money in NYC.
reviews.title: Pleased with the Waldorf-Astoria

likes.liked: — Size of the room. View. Clean. Location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Impressive hotel especially the lobby areas. The rooms and corridors are more dated and a little worn but the comfort and service makes up for it. Our room had the disadvantage of having a generator running all nights on the roof outside our window but with ear plugs you wouldnt hear it. However at a hotel of this claibre i would have expected double or tribble glazing on the rooms facing this internal lightwell to help dampern the generator noise or sort out the noise form the equipment in the first plave.
reviews.title: Worth the Experience-very good

reviews.text: That aside we had a lovely stay and would defenatily stay again i would just ask for a room well away for that roof in future.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, rooms vary

reviews.text: My sister and I were visiting NY and booked the Waldorf 7 months in advance. We arrived at 1 am without luggage as the airline had lost our luggage. The lobby is gorgeous and well maintained. The man at the front desk, I believe his name was Amin checked and found our room had been given away and immediately upgraded us to a luxury suite. He also assured us he would send up toiletries. He was very professional and helpful and such a relief to find someone so helpful in NY! Sure enough he sent up a great pack of all the toiletries we would need. The suite was nice and consisted of a living room, bedroom, front hall, dressing room and bathroom. The furnishings and window shades appeared to be a bit worn but other than that it was very nice. The next night we switched to a normal room which was a corner room overlooking Park Avenue. This room seemed very updated, was very large, had high ceilings and very comfortable. Our parents were also on the trip and I found their room to be a bit dark and also a little outdated and smaller so I think the rooms really vary. I would recommend asking for a corner room. The bathrooms are nice, GREAT water pressure. The actual location of the hotel is great because you are within walking distance of Times Square and Broadway but enough removed to not be in the middle of the chaos. Also being 2 blocks from 5th avenue was nice since we didn't have any luggage! The Bull and Bear Bar hosts the Fox Business Network show "happy hour" every weekday so we went and had a drink at the bar and watched the taping which was a lot of fun. We only ate at the hotel for breakfast at Oscars which was very good. Overall I am confident I would stay here again but would request a corner room. Great staff at both the front desk and restaurant.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel, friendly helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looking at the reviews here, I'm surprised.....I found this hotel to be absolutely clean, perfectly furnished, fabulous lobby, hallways to rooms beaufully well maintained and rooms with everything so clean and fresh, it looked as if the room had just been redecorated. Sfaff were consistly friendly, smiling, and helpful. drinks were over priced in the bar but the choice is yours' to drink elsewhere... loved it!!!
reviews.title: 1st class service with excellent facilities.

reviews.text: I recently stayed at The Waldorf Astoria in NYC for a holiday with my now fiancee.I got a great deal for 2 nights through hiltons own website. I had put on my booking form that i would be arriving on my birthday.I thought nothing more of it. From arriving with very bad jet lag and no bags (Grrr British Airways), the staff at the hotel couldnt do enough to make us feel welcome. They pointed us in the direction of clothes stores to purchase replacement clothes which the airline lost and generally made us feel special. On returning to the hotel after a days sightseeing, we returned to our room to find a tray of chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of champagne with a hand written card from the general manager wishing me a happy birthday and "if there was anything the hotel can do for you to enhance your stay, please do not hesitate to contact me". I was so impressed by this hotel and its staff i decided to propose to my girlfriend in the hotel as opposed to elsewhere in the city. It really was that good. I would recommend this hotel to anyone time and time again.
reviews.title: An old hotel with lots of character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel really was fabulous. I was a little nervous after reading all the negatice reviews but I didnt find one flaw with this gem. I only booked for one night on the hilton web site. I used my hilton honors # as well. When I checked in, no one mentioned it, but I had been upgraded to the towers, which is a fabulous hotel within the hotel. We were treated to a one bedroom suite which had its own parlor. The furniture was wonderfully correlated to the time period of the hotel. Dont expect modern funiture in a historic hotel like some of the others who wrote reviews. If you want a modern hotel, NYC has plenty of them. This hotel has a great location, great ambiance, and as far as I noticed, great staff.
reviews.title: Historic Hotel at its best

likes.disliked: — Certain entrances were closed at variuos times of day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for 6 nights and found from arriving to checking out the service we received was fantastic. The hotel was just as we had expected - very grand. The rooms were big and easily accomodated two people +many shopping purchases.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: The 2 bar areas were nice to relax in both before and after a meal. We didn't eat in the hotel as there were more than plenty of restaurants to sample in New York however our only complaint would be that 2 of the restaurants weren't open the full duration of our stay - had we have wanted to use them.
reviews.title: snobbish place does not worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend a visit to The London - Gordon Ramsay restaurant which was fantastic and only a short cab ride away.
reviews.title: Experience the grandeur

reviews.text: For our first visit to New York the Waldorf made us feel very welcome and we thoroughly enjoyed celebrating our first wedding anniversary in such style.
reviews.title: Waldorf Wows US

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a fantastic holiday in the USA (Chicago, New York, Boston and then a week on the Cape). New York was our second stop and the Waldorf had a lot to live up to as we had a fantastic stay in Chicago at the Omni Parker (see review) but she did not dissapoint. I had always wanted to stay at this hotel and with the $ being so weak againt the £ this was my chance. We did not want to be disappointed so we booked a jnr suite but on arrival to this magnicant hotel we were upgraded to a full suite. The rooms were huge and the bed was very large and super to sleep in. We had a very large sitting room with all the mod cons you could wish for and a sizable bedroom with great views of manhattan, we could not have asked for more. We did not eat in the hotel, however for a fun night out I would suggest "Ellen's Stardust Diner"! in mid town, has to experienced...
reviews.title: My 2nd Favourite hotel in the world!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: If Art Deco is your thing, The Waldorf Astoria is the place to stay. Entering the hotel is an experience as you will feel like going back in time to the times of black and white television. You can almost see the filmstars from the 30's walking around.
reviews.title: A Stay in Art Deco Style

likes.liked: — Art Deco Style and superd service

reviews.title: We felt special in every way!
reviews.text: The service is superb and almost everything is within walkin distance. And if you need a taxi you can simply walk out the door and there are taxis waiting for you. Also, The rooms are spacious with comfortable beds.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Waldorf Astoria was "all that" and "more". Even though we arrived late (12:15 AM) on one of the buisiest weekends in N.Y., Labor Day, and did not call ahead to explain our late arrival; we were treated with a smile EVEN when I requested a room with a view. After all, my daughter and I had come to N.Y.C. to celebrate her 40th birthday. Our view, from the 9th floor, was of Park Avenue and it was very very quiet.
reviews.title: One of the best Hilton hotels out there!

reviews.text: Not only was the view pleasant, but the room extremely enviting with beautiful furnishings and enterior decor. The beds were the most comfortable ever. We had a dressing room where we could set up our suitcases and ironing board. The bathroom was sparkling. On the ceiling, in the water closet, was a crystal chandalier. It was a hoot!
reviews.title: A Hilton at Heart

description: New York’s grandest landmark hotel, the city's first sky-scraper hotel opened on October 31, 1931, and is still delighting visitors with its elegant Art Deco accommodations. This 1,235-room hotel features luxurious guestrooms and spacious suites, 40 meeting rooms (60,000 square feet), three restaurants and bars, retail, Guerlain spa and fitness center.
